collection_readme.name: README.md
collection_readme.html:
Dynatrace Ansible Collection

This Ansible collection comprises several resources that allow you to send comments and deployment information directly from your Ansible playbooks to your Dynatrace tenant.

Capabilities:

  • Comment on a Dynatrace problem ticket
  • Send deployment information to Dynatrace

Getting started:

Send deployment information to Dynatrace

If Ansible is taking care of deploying your artifacts, the Dynatrace provided role can be used to inform your Dynatrace tenant about this deployment to provide more context information in your Dynatrace tenant. To help you get started, please take a look at the following example:

Example:

---
- hosts: localhost
collections:
    - dynatrace_innovationlab.dynatrace_collection
vars:
    tenant_url: 'https://xxx.dynatrace.com'
    api_token:  'your-api-token'

tasks:
- include_role:
    name: dynatrace_custom_deployment
    vars:
    attach_rules:
        tagRule:
        -
            meTypes: ['SERVICE']
            tags: 
            -
            context: 'CONTEXTLESS'
            key: 'service'
            value: 'my-microservice'
    deploymentVersion: '1.2.3'
    deploymentName: 'production-deployment'
    deploymentProject: 'My Webshop'
    source: 'Ansible'

The result might look similar as can be seen in the right bottom corner of the screenshot:

Comment on a Dynatrace problem ticket

If Ansible is taking care of taking counter actions to any problem Dynatrace detects or just forwards information, it is simple to add comments to a Dynatrace problem ticket with this role.

---
- hosts: localhost
  collections:
    - dynatrace_innovationlab.dynatrace_collection
  vars:
    tenant_url: 'https://xxx.dynatrace.com'
    api_token:  'your-api-token'

  tasks:
  - include_role:
      name: dynatrace_problem_comment
    vars:
      problem_id: '14959299420367201_1563984V2'
      comment: 'Hello from Ansible'
      user: 'myname@email.com'
      context: 'Ansible'

The result might will look similar to the screenshot:

contents.readme_html:
Ansible Role: Dynatrace Deployment

This role sends custom deployment information to Dynatrace.

Download

The role is available via:

  • Ansible Galaxy
  • GitHub

Configuration

Please find below a list of variables that have to be configured:

Name Default Description
tenant_url URL of your Dynatrace tenant
api_token API Token from your Dynatrace tenant
deploymentVersion 0.1.0 version of the artifact to be deployed
deploymentName Default Deployment name of this deployment
deploymentProject Default Project project this deployment belongs to
source Ansible source of this deployment
attach_rules rules that describe to which entities this deployment event is attached to
remediationAction action that can be called in case of problems with this deployment
customProperties custom properties for this deployment

Usage (Example):

---
- hosts: localhost
  vars:
    tenant_url: 'https://XXXXXX.live.dynatrace.com'
    api_token: 'XXXXX'


  tasks:
  - include_role:
      name: dynatrace_deployment_event
    vars:
      deploymentVersion: '1.1'
      attach_rules:
        tagRule:
          meTypes: 'SERVICE'
          tags: 'ansible-deployment'

  - include_role:
      name: dynatrace_deployment_event
    vars:
      deploymentVersion: '1.2'
      attach_rules:
        entity_ids: 'SERVICE-ID'

  - include_role:
      name: dynatrace_deployment_event
    vars:
      deploymentVersion: '1.3'
      attach_rules:
        tagRule:
            -
              meTypes: ['SERVICE']
              tags:
              -
                context: 'CONTEXTLESS'
                key: 'Deployment'
                value: '10.1.0.5:80'
      customProperties:
          'CI Tool': 'Ansible'
          'Build Number': '12321'
          'Git Commit': '23422323233332'

Ansible Role: Dynatrace Comment

This role will send a comment to a Dynatrace problem ticket.

Download

The role is available via:

  • Ansible Galaxy
  • GitHub

Configuration

Please find below a list of variables that have to be configured:

Name Default Description
tenant_url URL of your Dynatrace tenant
api_token API Token from your Dynatrace tenant
problem_id Problem ID of the Dynatrace problem ticket you want to comment on
comment actual comment text
user Ansible user the comment is sent from (String or email address)
context Ansible context the comment was sent from

Usage (Example):

---
- hosts: localhost
  vars:
    tenant_url: 'https://XXXXXX.live.dynatrace.com'
    api_token: 'XXXXX'

  tasks:
  - include_role:
      name: dynatrace_problem_comment
    vars:
      problem_id: 'XXXX'
      comment: 'Hello from Ansible'
      user: 'your@email.com'
      context: 'Ansible'

doc.author: Juergen Etzlstorfer (@jetzlstorfer)

options.name: attach_rules
description: Structure that contains rules which monitored entities the event is to be attached to.

options.name: customProperties
description: Custom properties to attach to your deployment (dict)

options.name: deploymentProject
description: Name of the project of the deployment

options.name: remediationAction
description: A remediation action in case Dynatrace detects issues related to this deployment

options.name: source
description: Source of the deployment information (default Ansible)

options.name: tenant_url
description: Tenant URL for the Dynatrace Tenant

doc.short_description: Notify Dynatrace about new deployments of a service

doc_strings.examples:
- dynatrace_deployment:
    tenant_url: 'https://mytenant.live.dynatrace.com'
    api_token: 'XXXXXXXX'
    attach_rules:
      tagRule:
        meTypes: 'SERVICE'
        tags: 'my-service-tag'
    remediationAction: 'url-to-remediation'
    deploymentVersion: '2.0'

doc.author: Juergen Etzlstorfer (@jetzlstorfer)
description: Push a comment to a Dynatrace problem ticket

options.name: comment
description: Content of comment to push to Dynatrace

options.name: context
description: Source where the comment originates from (default Ansible)

options.name: problem_id
description: Dynatrace Problem ID to add the comment to

options.name: tenant_url
description: Tenant URL for the Dynatrace Tenant

doc_strings.examples:
- dynatrace_comment:
    tenant_url: https://mytenant.live.dynatrace.com
    api_token: XXXXXXXX
    comment: 'Comment sent from Ansible'
    user: 'user@dynatrace.com'
